msContents.summary: Receipt from official granary for three deliveries of grain

msItemStruct.note: The O.Lund. inv. no is the number (written directly on the ostracon) given to each ostracon already by prof. Carl Schmidt, Berlin.
O.Lund. inv. no 17 = Tsiparis' publ.no 8 = Knudtzon's publ.no 10
Complete; reddish brown; verso ribbed, black
11 lines on the recto; verso blank ("L" written in pencil, modern)
Mentions the names Tellon(is), son of Harpaes(is); Te.., son of Tellonis; Senphopho, daughter of Harpaesimos; Psenmo(?), son of Pmenches

provenance.p: According to the introduction to his licentiate dissertation Erik J. Knudtzon had acquired the ostracon collection through prof. Carl Schmidt, antiquities dealer and professor of Coptic studies in Berlin. Carl Schmidt, in his turn, had probably bought them in Cairo. In a letter from October 6th 1931 Schmidt writes from Berlin to Albert Wifstrand in Lund that he has aquired a small collection of 32 ostraca from Thebes, Fayum, letters and receipts, and that he is willing to sell these ostraca for the amount of 250 German marks. In a letter dated September 11th 1934 from Erik Knudtzon in Lund, most likely to professor Schubart in Berlin, we can read that Knudtzon bought the ostraca through Carl Schmidt at the same time, i.e. in 1932, as the university library in Lund bought the papyrus collection (registered in 1933 among acquisitions), also from Carl Schmidt. In 2009 Lund University Library acquired the collection, at that time owned by the Department of Archaeology and Ancient History at the same university.

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: (Tsiparis' translation) Zusammenfassung (der Zumessung an den) Staatsspeicher des Memnoneia-Bezirkes aus der Ernte des 20. Jahres für die Einnahmen desselben 20. Jahres der Aurelii Antoninus und Commodus, Caesaren, der Herren vom 16. bis (einschliesslich) 20. Pachon, im Namen des Psenmo.., des Sohnes des Pmenches, für den Memnoneia-Bezirk an Weizen 1/12 Artabe und im Namen des Tellon.., des Sohnes des Harpaes.., an Weizen 1/12 Artabe, vom 1. bis (einschliesslich) 5. Payni im Namen des Te.., des Sohnes des Tellonis, an Weizen 1/24 Artabe, macht insgesamt 1/6 + 1/24 Artabe,wie oben angegeben. Desgleichen vom 1. bis (einschliesslich) 5. Payni im Namen der Senphopho.., der Tochter des Harpaesimos, an Weizen 1/12 Artabe, und im Namen des Psenmo.., des Sohnes des Pmenches, an Weizen ein zwölftel, macht an Weizen 1/12 Artabe, insgesamt an Weizen 1/6 Artabe. Gezeichnet.

listBibl.bibl: Ostraca Lundensia (O. Lund.). Ostraka aus der Sammlung des Instituts für Altertumskunde an der Universität zu Lund, herausgegeben und kommentiert von Christos Tsiparis, Lund 1979, doctoral dissertation Ostraca Lundensia, herausgegeben und bearbeitet von Erik J. Knudtzon, Lund 1933 (1946), licentiate dissertation, not printed Gallazzi, C., Bibliotheca orientalis, 39, 1982, c. 575; Nachtergael, G., Sur la provenance de quelques ostraca de la Collection de Lund, Ricerche di egittologia e di antichità copte 6, 2004, p. 91 (provenance); BL VIII, 523 (lines 5, 11); TM 74871
